_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Pipeline Transportation of Refined Petroleum Products

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Buckeye Pipe Line Company, L.P. - Macungie Station is a pipeline breakout and distribution station that includes a butane blending operation (onsite storage of butane with the provisions to enable direct injection and blending into the gasoline).  The Risk Management Plan covers the butane blending system including six horizontal storage vessels, transfer equipment, and associated piping and appurtenances.



The Buckeye Pipe Line Company, L.P. - Macungie Station Butane Blending System was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association Code #58 for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage and it is the Facility's policy to follow the most current future editions to the extent feasible and adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and Local codes/laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is the Facility's policy to contact the Lower Macungie Fire Department and the Lehigh County Emergency Management Agency, as appropriate, through the 911 Service.  Medical emergencies will require notification of Macungie Ambulance Corps and Lehigh Valley Hospital.  The primary hospital response is provided through the Lehigh Valley Hospital (a Level 1 Trauma Center).  The Facility currently maintains a trained incipient stage fire response and first responder-operations level hazardous materials response team to respond to the initial stages of an emergency.



The Buckeye Pipe Line Company, L.P. - Macungie Station Butane Blending System complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D- Program Level 3).  Additionally, this plan meets the requirements of the U.S. Department of Labor - Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management regulations (inclusive of all 14 elements) for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (29 CFR Part 1910.119).



The Worst Case and Alternate Case release scenarios were evaluated and communicated to the local responders.  Additionally, the local Emergency Response

Action Plan was updated to reflect the addition of butane.



This Facility has never had an accident or incident involving the covered process that resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering-in-place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Macungie Station butane blending system, it is the policy of the Facility to initially contact the Lower Macungie Fire Department and request their assistance.  The Facility's Emergency Response Action Plan is coordinated with the Lower Macungie Fire Department and the Lehigh County Emergency Management Agency.  The fire department is aware of the Facility's butane blending system, its safety systems, access points, and protective procedures in the event of a significant release.  The Station is fully secured with fencing and controlled access in accordance with its site security plan.



Buckeye continually evaluates the process for opportunities to improve safety.  Also, Buckeye is implementing a corporate-wide policy to include the local first responders in regular exercises and in all 3 year PSM/RMP training cycles and is developing "global" operating procedures.
